page.title: 14Recreation in Bingley
page.content: Bingley has two public parks. The Prince of Wales Park (18.5 acres) and Myrtle Park (27.5 acres). Myrtle Park has a bandstand, bowling greens, tennis courts and a children's playground. The Bingley Show and Children's Gala are held annually in the park. Next to the park is the swimming baths opened in 1927 and recently brought up to date with a sauna and solarium. The swimming club caters for all ages. There is a mother and toddle group. there are two municipal golf courses, at Beckfoot and St.Ives, as well as tennis, cricket and rugby clubs. Bingley Harriers is a successful athletics club which, together with Bingley Lions organise the Half Marathon which this year attracted more than 900 entrants.
